content: The majority of justices on Brazil's Supreme Court panel reviewing former President Jair Bolsonaro's appeal rejected his request on Friday.

title: "Will Remember This": Jamaica, Cuba Praise India For Support After Hurricane
content: Cuba and Jamaica have publicly thanked India for standing with them after Hurricane Melissa tore through the Caribbean, leaving widespread destruction and a rising death toll.

title: James Watson, Co-Discoverer Of DNA Double-Helix, Dies At 97
content: James D. Watson, whose co-discovery of the twisted-ladder structure of DNA in 1953 helped light the long fuse on a revolution in medicine, crimefighting, genealogy and ethics, has died, according to his former research lab. He was 97.

title: Several Huts Burnt In Massive Slum Fire In Delhi
content: A massive fire broke out in a cluster of huts near Rithala metro station in Delhi's Rohini late on Friday night, Delhi Fire Services (DFS) said.

title: Video: Street Fight Between College Students In Bengaluru
content: The incident took place on Wednesday outside a private college on North Bengaluru's Hesaraghatta Road.

title: "Don't Send Me": Parents Say 9-Year-Old Who Jumped To Death Was Bullied In School
content: In a quiet Jaipur home, the voice of nine-year-old Amaiyra still echoes from a WhatsApp recording her mother made a year ago. In the clip, the Class 4 student can be heard sobbing: "I don't want to go to school... don't send me."

title: What Foreign Ministry Said On Trump's India Visit
content: The Ministry of External Affairs on Friday clarified it has 'nothing' to share on US President Donald Trump's visit to India despite his recent remarks suggesting that the trip could take place next year.

title: Case Against 4 Voters For Taking Photos Of EVMs In Bihar
content: Cases were registered against four persons in Bihar for allegedly clicking photos of EVMs during voting and sharing them on social media, officials said on Friday.

content: The late-night panic over a suspected abduction in Coimbatore, which prompted a massive police search, has turned out to be a false alarm.

title: Synthetic Drug Cartel Busted In Tamil Nadu, 3 Foreigners Among 14 Arrested
content: The police have busted a major interstate synthetic drug cartel controlled by foreign nationals residing in Tamil Nadu, uncovering a highly sophisticated supply chain spanning multiple states.

title: Madras High Court Reserves Order TVK Leader's Plea To Cancel Case Over Post On Karur Stampede
content: The Madras High Court has reserved its orders on a petition filed by Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) General Secretary Aadhav Arjuna, seeking to cancel an FIR registered against him for allegedly posting an inflammatory message on social media.

title: Nirmala Sitharaman Unveils 2 Major Guwahati Landmarks Worth Rs 327 Crore
content: It's a moment of pride for Guwahati as Assam's most ambitious urban beautification initiatives - the Guwahati Gateway River Terminal and the Brahmaputra Riverfront, were inaugurated today by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

title: Sikkim To Offer Free Cervical Cancer Vaccines To Girls Below 14 Years
content: Sikkim Chief Minister Prem Singh Tamang on Friday announced that all girls below the age of 14 in the state will receive free vaccination against cervical cancer from April 2026.

title: Explained: Delhi Airport Tech Glitch That Delayed Nearly 800 Flights
content: Nearly 800 flights were delayed at the Delhi airport, India's busiest, after a major technical glitch hit its Air Traffic Control (ATC) system on Thursday evening, disrupting flight planning and causing a ripple effect across multiple airports.

title: HAL Signs Pact For 113 Jet Engines To Power Tejas Mark 1A Fleet
content: In a significant development for India's indigenous fighter jet programme, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited inked a deal with US-based General Electric for the supply of more than 100 jet engines to power the Light Combat Aircraft Tejas Mark-1A.

title: 2-Year-Old Boy Killed After Lorry Crashes Into Wall In Bengaluru
content: A two-year-old boy was killed on Friday after a cement lorry mixer crashed into a compound wall in Bengaluru.

title: Street Dog Dies After Being Thrown Onto Transformer In Jaipur
content: An incident of animal cruelty has come to light in Jaipur's Bhankrota area, where a street dog was allegedly tied up and thrown onto an electrical transformer, leading to its death by electrocution, an official said on Friday.

title: Calcutta High Court Gives Conditional Bail To Convict Suffering From HIV
content: The Calcutta High Court has granted conditional bail to a man serving a life term after noting that he has been in jail for nearly 15 years and is suffering from HIV, while his appeal against conviction remains pending.

title: "Historic Moment": Last Active Maoist In Chhattisgarh's Gariaband Surrenders
content: In a major breakthrough for Chhattisgarh's anti-Maoist operations, the last active Maoist in Gariaband district, Sunil alias Jagtar Singh, surrendered before police on Friday.

title: Elephant Brought For Tiger-Tracking Enters Karnataka Town, Creates Panic
content: A trained elephant brought in for a tiger-tracking operation caused panic when it entered a town in Karnataka's Chamarajanagar district after being bitten by insects on Friday.

title: Bihar polls: Record turnout triggers guessing game ‚Äî will it help or hurt Nitish?
content: Bihar's first phase saw record voter turnout, sparking debate on whether it favors the incumbent Nitish Kumar or signals anti-incumbency. Both NDA and Mahagathbandhan claim the surge benefits them. Historical trends suggest high turnout often indicates a regime change, but analysts point to recent government schemes potentially aiding the NDA.

title: Pak-Afghan tensions: Islamabad says truce talks collapse; fate of ceasefire unclear
content: Pakistan's defence minister has declared talks with Afghanistan have effectively collapsed. This comes after negotiators failed to bridge significant gaps. Weeks of border fighting have led to casualties on both sides. Qatar mediated a ceasefire, but sporadic clashes continue. The long-standing dispute over the Durand Line border remains a core issue.

title: Ford CEO questions Apple‚Äôs CarPlay: Warns of overreach; questions Tim Cook
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley expressed strong concerns about Apple's CarPlay Ultra, fearing it encroaches too deeply into vehicle control. He questioned how far Apple's brand should extend into car functions, emphasizing the digital experience as a key differentiator for future vehicles. This follows similar reservations from other automakers and GM's decision to drop both CarPlay and Android Auto.

title: Musk to Tesla shareholders: May be, we will do something with Intel
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk revealed the company is developing its fifth-generation AI chip, AI5, for self-driving systems and is considering collaboration with Intel. Musk also mentioned Tesla might build a "gigantic chip fab" due to supplier limitations, with AI5 production slated for 2026 and AI6 for 2028. This announcement followed shareholder approval of Musk's substantial pay package.

title: Mamdani‚Äôs rise throws up immigrants fear vs affordability crisis debate in MAGA world
content: New York City's political landscape is electrified by Zohran Mamdani's stunning mayoral victory, sparking contrasting reactions from MAGA supporters and progressives. While some fear a leftist takeover, others see Mamdani's win as a catalyst for addressing affordability, a theme even Donald Trump is now acknowledging, signaling a potential shift in political discourse.

title: Google‚Äôs AI investment: Company may bet ‚Äòbig‚Äô on Anthropic; equalise fight with OpenAI
content: Google is reportedly in early discussions for a major investment in Anthropic. This move escalates the global AI race, putting pressure on Microsoft-backed OpenAI. The potential funding could value Anthropic at over $350 billion. Google's strategic push aims to provide Anthropic with crucial resources to compete effectively in the evolving AI landscape.

title: Cricket in LA28: ICC reveals number of teams for men's and women's events
content: Cricket will make its return to the Olympic Games at the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics, featuring both men's and women's T20 tournaments. Each division will consist of six teams competing in a total of 28 matches, with 90 athlete quotas allocated per gender. This historic inclusion marks cricket's first Olympic appearance in 128 years.

title: Marshawn Kneeland death: Darius Slay‚Äôs wife Jennifer shares emotional plea
content: Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland, 24, died by self-inflicted gunshot wound days after scoring his first NFL touchdown. His death followed a brief police pursuit. The tragedy has prompted widespread grief and calls for greater mental health awareness in the NFL, with many teammates and public figures sharing their sorrow and support.

title: Sidney Crosby future: GM Kyle Dubas makes firm call on Penguins captain
content: Pittsburgh Penguins GM Kyle Dubas has definitively stated that captain Sidney Crosby's future remains with the team. Dubas emphasized his commitment to building a contending roster around Crosby, with no plans to trade the veteran.  He believes continued success and winning are the best solutions for the team's long-term vision.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen says prioritizing Tom Brady took a toll: ‚ÄúLove isn‚Äôt a jail
content: Supermodel Gisele B√ºndchen, in a candid interview, shared insights into her marriage with Tom Brady, describing their split as a 'death and rebirth.' She detailed her journey of shifting from supporting her partner's career to rediscovering her own dreams and defining personal success. B√ºndchen emphasizes her graciousness towards Brady, highlighting her focus on authenticity and fulfillment in her new chapter.

title: 'Can't live with them anymore': Telangana woman kills self over fear of ants
content: A 25-year-old woman in Sangareddy district allegedly died by suicide due to a severe childhood fear of ants. She reportedly took the extreme step after noticing ants while cleaning her home. Her husband discovered her after returning from work, and a suicide note was found.

title: Taylor Swift Grammy 2026: Did she make the list amid Kelce wedding buzz?
content: Taylor Swift's latest album, 'The Life of a Showgirl,' released October 3, 2025, is ineligible for the 2026 Grammy Awards due to the eligibility period. Fans are disappointed, but Swift is reportedly focused on wedding plans with Travis Kelce. She recently explained her absence from the Super Bowl Halftime show, citing her dedication to Kelce's demanding NFL career.

title: Immigration crackdown: Canada tightens visa rules; over 5L Indian students under lens
content: Canada has updated immigration guidelines, empowering officers to cancel already-issued visitor visas, study permits, and work permits. This shift emphasizes ongoing compliance with immigration conditions, impacting international students and frequent visitors. The changes aim to strengthen oversight and prevent program misuse.

title: Mega defence deal: India inks $1bn pact with US firm GE for 113 fighter jet engines
content: India's HAL has secured a significant $1 billion deal with GE for 113 jet engines for its LCA Mk1A fighter jets, ensuring timely deliveries.  Additionally, HAL is partnering with Russia's UAC to manufacture the SJ-100 civil commuter aircraft in India, marking a major step towards self-reliance in civil aviation and boosting regional connectivity.

title: 'Situation normal soon': Delhi airport glitch fixed; backlog continues, 800 flights impacted
content: A technical glitch in Delhi airport's air traffic control messaging system (AMSS) disrupted over 800 flights, causing significant delays and at least 20 cancellations. The system failure forced air traffic controllers to switch to manual procedures, impacting flight-plan distribution and leading to extended wait times for passengers.

title: Michael Porter Jr & Sophie Cunningham spark dating rumors with viral post
content: Recent viral rumors falsely linked NBA star Michael Porter Jr. and WNBA player Sophie Cunningham romantically. The speculation stemmed from a parody account, despite the two being lifelong friends from the same hometown. Porter Jr. has previously faced criticism for his comments on women's basketball, and his mention of Cunningham appears to be an attempt to mend fences.

title: 'Mamu Gang' mastermind arrested: Delhi Police nab fruit seller who led bank robberies
content: Delhi Police Crime Branch has arrested Kamrul alias Mamu, a 51-year-old fruit seller, who masterminded the "Mamu Gang" involved in interstate bank burglaries. Posing as a humble vendor by day, he meticulously planned heists, striking at night with precision to disable alarms and break into vaults. His arrest has solved three major bank burglary cases in Karnataka.

title: 'Sachin sir called before the final': Harmanpreet Kaur
content: India's captain Harmanpreet Kaur revealed Sachin Tendulkar's pre-match advice helped her team stay grounded before their historic World Cup triumph.  She described the "world champion" feeling as surreal, crediting key players like Smriti Mandhana, Deepti Sharma, and Shafali Verma for their pivotal roles in the victory. The magnitude of the achievement is still sinking in for the captain.

title: 'Some kind of idiot': Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath on MBA students; claims 'colleges are dead'
content: Nikhil Kamath, co-founder of Zerodha, believes traditional colleges are obsolete. He argues that online platforms and AI offer superior learning to MBA programs. Kamath suggests that formal degrees are becoming less relevant as companies like Meta and Apple shift focus from qualifications to practical skills. Vocational training is expected to gain prominence.

title: Elon Musk: Teach critical thinking to kids; why it matters
content: Critical thinking, not rote memorization, is vital for children's development, as highlighted by Elon Musk. Research shows that fostering curiosity, play, and exploration significantly boosts problem-solving and cognitive flexibility. Schools globally lag in teaching these essential skills, which empower kids to discern truth, make sound decisions, and navigate a complex world, ultimately becoming a lifelong superpower.

title: Crypto market wipeout: Digital assets erase nearly all 2025 gains
content: The cryptocurrency market has seen a significant downturn, losing substantial ground after a record high. This slump, triggered by liquidations and investor caution, has erased most of this year's gains. Bitcoin has fallen below a key technical level, while smaller altcoins are experiencing even steeper losses.

title: 'Slap in the face': Job-hunting Indian students in limbo; $100K H-1B fee creates chaos
content: Indian students in the US face job rejections due to a significant H-1B visa fee hike by the Trump administration, impacting their career prospects. Companies are increasingly hesitant to sponsor, leading to a sharp decline in available positions for international graduates.

title: Drama at Chess WC! Lithuania GM complaints against India's Pranav
content: Drama unfolded at the FIDE World Cup as Indian prodigy Pranav V faced a complaint from Grandmaster Titas Stremavicius for failing to record moves. After a brief interruption and a warning, Pranav secured a victory. Meanwhile, Arjun Erigaisi and P. Harikrishna delivered strong wins, while D. Gukesh drew his match.

title: PM's Seemanchal pitch sets BJP agenda: Will 'infiltrators' shape phase 2 of Bihar polls?
content: As Bihar's election enters its second phase, the BJP is shifting its campaign focus to "infiltration," with Prime Minister Modi highlighting the issue in border regions.  He accused the opposition of shielding "infiltrators" for votes, framing it as a national security challenge. This narrative aims to counter traditional opposition strongholds in Seemanchal, emphasizing identity and security over development.

title: Revealed! Absence from Jota's funeral: Ronaldo breaks silence
content: Cristiano Ronaldo explained his absence from Diogo Jota's funeral, stating his presence would have caused a "circus" and disrupted the solemn occasion. He emphasized his decision was rooted in respect, not indifference, and that he felt good about his choice. Ronaldo had previously expressed his condolences on social media following Jota's tragic death.

title: 'Islamic bomb': Ex-CIA officer reveals what drove Pak to build nukes; makes big Indira claim
content: Former CIA officer Richard Barlow revealed Pakistan's nuclear program evolved from countering India to creating an "Islamic bomb" for Muslim nations, driven by A.Q. Khan. Barlow also criticized US "negligence" in addressing Pakistan's nuclear dealings for decades. India maintains a No First Use policy, unlike Pakistan.

title: ‚ÄòWe are on same page‚Äô: Tej Pratap meets Ravi Kishan at airport - will he join NDA?
content: Janshakti Janata Dal founder Tej Pratap Yadav and BJP MP Ravi Kishan were seen together at Patna airport, fueling speculation during Bihar's election season. Yadav, expelled from RJD, stated their shared devotion to Lord Shiva and hinted at aligning with anyone addressing unemployment. Kishan emphasized the BJP's openness to devotees of Bholenath.

title: WBSSC SLST result out: Check official notice and steps to download scorecard here
content: The West Bengal School Service Commission (WBSSC) has officially declared the SLST Result 2025, marking a crucial step in filling 35,726 Assistant Teacher vacancies across government-aided schools for classes IX to XII. Candidates who cleared the written exam can now proceed to interviews, with final selections based on combined scores and document verification, ensuring subject-specific teaching expertise statewide.

title: '44 Indians in Russian army': MEA in touch with Kremlin; issues serious warning
content: India has identified 44 nationals serving in the Russian Army amid the Ukraine conflict and urged Moscow for their release. The Ministry of External Affairs is coordinating with Russian authorities and affected families, warning citizens against dangerous recruitment offers. This comes as families protest, seeking government intervention for their relatives allegedly misled into fighting.

title: Trillionaire, billionaire, socialist: Musk, Trump, Mamdani - what's going on in US
content: New York City elected democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani as mayor, promising progressive policies. Meanwhile, Tesla shareholders approved a massive pay package for CEO Elon Musk, potentially making him the world's first trillionaire. These events highlight a divided America, with the billionaire class ascending while the working class demands change.

title: Man tied to pole and set on fire by 3 in UP, critical
content:
Representative image

BAREILLY: A 22-year-old man, Mohd Mehboob, suffered severe burn injuries and is in a critical condition after three unidentified men allegedly tied him to a pole, poured petrol on him and set him on fire while he was returning from a mosque after offering Friday namaz. As the ropes got burned, he could free himself and managed to reach home. His family rushed him to the nearby community health centre, which referred him to another hospital. Mehboob‚Äôs father, Abdul Sattar, claimed his son suffered 50% burns. The family has filed a complaint, but no FIR has been registered yet. Budaun SP (Rural) Hridesh Katheria said, ‚ÄúIt seems the attackers first poured petrol on the man and set him on fire. The victim told police that he had an argument with the accused men Thursday. Three suspects have been detained for questioning.‚Äù ‚ÄúAll aspects of the case are being probed,‚Äù said SP Katheria.

End of Article

title: Rankings, contract projections for top 50 MLB free agents
content: the free agency offseason kicks off at 5 p.m. ET on friday . it's time to rank the 2025-26 free agent class and predict how much money each player will get . the goal is to predict what will happen, not decide what each player is worth .

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 10: What will it take for Darnold to get more love?

content: the hospital will serve as a lifeline for five southern talukas of Gadchiroli . patients earlier had to travel long distances to Chandrapur or Nagpur for advanced maternity care . the inauguration of women's hospital and newborn baby centre is aimed at strengthening maternal and child healthcare .

title: Why was Ja Morant suspended? What we know about the latest Grizzlies drama
content: grizzlies guard Ja Morant is frustrated with his joy for the game of basketball . the Grizzlies are frustrated, too, suspending Morant for a game over the weekend because of conduct detrimental to the team . morant missed the loss to the Toronto Raptors on Sunday, then had 18 points .

title: For PIL on 1950 quota order, Supreme Court raps law student: 'Focus on studies'
content: a third-year law student fumbled but regained composure to say it affects my interest . a bench led by CJI-designate Surya Kant asked when was the Presidential Order issued specifying which scheduled caste communities would get reservation? he told the students that he must research and file a proper PIL and not one like the present one .

title: Omar Abdullah blames PDP for axing of Article 370 , J&K‚Äôs UT status
content: CM Omar Abdullah was addressing a gathering in the assembly constituency going to vote in the bypoll on November 11 . he had vacated the seat he won in last year‚Äôs assembly polls in the state along with his traditional seat of Ganderbal .

title: After 8 years on the run, man held for journo's murder
content: police arrested Gaurav Kumar, wanted for the double murder of a senior journalist . the "model worker" had been promoted from security guard to manager at a construction firm . he was taken completely by surprise when a team from police's "Proclaimed Offenders Staff" surrounded him .

title: Wildlife panel gives nod to 13 defence projects
content:
.

National Board for Wildlife - a panel that takes decisions on projects in areas near wildlife protected zones - has given its approval to 13 defence and paramilitary projects, most in Ladakh and one in Arunachal Pradesh. Clearances have been given on conditions of following environmental safeguards and mitigation plans to protect Himalayan ecosystems. The projects include new border outposts, a brigade headquarters, ammunition storage and training facilities, and bridge work.

End of Article

title: Teen rape survivor can terminate 27-week pregnancy, says High Court
content: a 15-year-old rape survivor is going to take her class 10 exams in march . she is beyond the 24-week permissible limit under the medical Termination of Pregnancy Act, 1971 . the girl's petition filed through her father seeks HC's permission .

title: India inks $1 billion deal for 113 Tejas engines
content: the delivery of 113 new GE-F404 engines to defence PSU Hindustan Aeronautics will take place in the 2027-2032 timeframe, adding to the delayed supply of 99 engines ordered under a Rs 5,375 crore deal in Aug 2021 . pending trials of astra beyond visual range air-to-air missiles and laser-guided bombs as well as their integration with the israel-origin Elta ELM-based .

title: US to deny visas to people with diabetes, heart disease and other chronic illnesses
content: foreign nationals seeking to immigrate to the united states could now be denied visas and green cards . the directive significantly expands the criteria for who is deemed a potential "public charge" a cable sent by the state department instructs visa officers to flag applicants whose medical conditions could require "hundreds of thousands of dollars' worth of care"

title: Bike stunt by 4 youths kills Kanpur woman
content:
Representative image

KANPUR: A bike stunt by four youths on Thursday claimed the life of a 23-year-old woman on the Ganga Barrage in Kanpur in Uttar Pradesh. Bhavika Gupta, the victim, had gone to the barrage with her friend on a two-wheeler on Thursday evening. Her family said she was just a few metres away from the barrage when four youths on two bikes came speeding, and one of them rammed into her scooter. Bhavika was dragged for at least 50m, her family said, adding the bikes were cruising at 110 km/hr. Bhavika died at the hospital. The youths fled leaving behind one sports bike. The vehicle bore the social media details of one Brijesh Nishad. When checked, the photo of a youth on a sports bike was found. Below the post were some comments wanting to know "whether he (Brijesh) was alive after the accident at Ganga Barrage". Police are on the look out for the accused. tnn

End of Article
